poem.title: Drag
poem.author: Jan Beatty
poem.powersystem: They say I have attachment disorder from years in the orphanage-I say I'm attached to dirt: to the grit of stones, pulverized metal from the slag heap, I learned touch from air, I fashioned love from strangers. Your families make no sense to me. My mother's the 4 barrel of a 409, my heart's dragstripped from the shredded tires of predators. Go ahead, think of me- throw the red flag down. I'm one you never figured, dead engine start on a quarter-mile strip, my lo-jack is the split/ the pull away- you back there, me running the distance.
